  • Uses of GameState in net.royalur.rules.state

    Subclasses of GameState in net.royalur.rules.state
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    class 
    ActionGameState<P extends Piece,S extends PlayerState,R extends Roll>
    A game state that is included in the middle of a game to record an action that was taken, but that is not a valid state to be in.
    class 
    MovedGameState<P extends Piece,S extends PlayerState,R extends Roll>
    A game state that represents a move of a piece on the board.
    class 
    OngoingGameState<P extends Piece,S extends PlayerState,R extends Roll>
    A game state from within a game where a winner has not yet been determined.
    class 
    PlayableGameState<P extends Piece,S extends PlayerState,R extends Roll>
    A game state where we are waiting for interactions from a player.
    class 
    RolledGameState<P extends Piece,S extends PlayerState,R extends Roll>
    A game state that represents a roll that was made in a game.
    class 
    WaitingForMoveGameState<P extends Piece,S extends PlayerState,R extends Roll>
    A game state where the game is waiting for a player to make a move.
    class 
    WaitingForRollGameState<P extends Piece,S extends PlayerState,R extends Roll>
    A game state where the game is waiting for a player to roll the dice.
    class 
    WinGameState<P extends Piece,S extends PlayerState,R extends Roll>
    A game state where a player has won the game.
